definition:
The [*difference quotient*]{} $$\frac{f(z+\Delta{z})-f(z)}{\Delta{z}}$$
of a or real function $f$ is the ratio of the change of the function to
the corresponding change of the variable.

The difference quotient is needed in defining the derivative of the
function. In the case of a real function $f$ the difference quotient may
be interpreted as the slope of a secant line of the graph of the
function.
